===Appearance===
Watanabe wears a standard uniform modeled from the {{Lang|''ashigaru''|ja=足軽}} of feudal Japan. He wears a purple-gray ''shitagi'', gray ''kobakama'', white socks, and ''waraji'' sandals. His eggplant-colored armor with gray accents consists of ''dou'' (breastplate) with the [[Inazuma Shogunate]]'s crest, ''han-kote'' (half-armored sleeves), ''haidate'' (thigh guards), and ''sune-ate'' (greaves). He is equipped with a ''juumonji yari'' (cross-shaped spear), whose shaft is lavender colored, and contains the Shogunate crest under the spearhead.

==Dialogue==
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Watanabe:''' I should really push these new guys harder. Tomorrow, I'll make them stand at attention for half an hour and then give them a set of one hundred push-ups.
:{{DIcon}} Who are you?
::'''Watanabe:''' I'm a Doushin in charge of recruit training here. You can call me Instructor Watanabe.
::'''Watanabe:''' I've got to say that the recruits nowadays lack perseverance and patience. How will they serve the Shogun like that?
::'''Watanabe:''' Eh... why am I telling you this stuff? No outsiders are allowed on the drill grounds!
:{{DIcon}} Goodbye.
::'''Watanabe:''' Glory to the Shogun and her everlasting reign!
{{Dialogue End}}

==Event Dialogue==
===Enchanted Tales of the Mikawa Festival===
====Dialogue Set #1====
''Available before completing [[As Though Caught in a Dream]]''
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Watanabe:''' Our rookies lack vigilance, I say. If they were to encounter some crisis... Eh, what am I saying? A crisis, at a festival?

====Dialogue Set #2====

{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Watanabe:''' *sigh* And that's what I've been telling our rookies this whole time... Ah, greetings, {{MC|m=sir|f=ma'am}}! I've been keeping an eye on this area. I'll inform you if anything happens!
{{Dialogue End}}

====Dialogue Set #3====
''Available after completing [[As Though Beholding Illusions]]''

:'''Watanabe:''' Well now, looks like our rookies are all fired up &mdash; and I didn't even have to try. Based on this momentum, now might be a good time to lock our future training schedule in...
